title: Trump to Deploy Troops to Portland, Threatens "Full Force" Use
snippets: President Trump said Saturday he will send troops to Portland, "authorizing Full Force, if necessary" to handle "domestic terrorists" as he expands his controversial deployments to more U.S. cities.
US President Donald Trump claimed that Antifa is waging "war" on the famously progressive city. Portland's mayor has rejected these claims.
Trump directs troops to Portland with "full force" directive &n

Apparently misled by hyperbolic reporting from conservative outlets on a single small protest, president described peaceful city as ‘war ravaged’

Donald Trump said on Saturday he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local offic
Portland Mayor Keith Wilson said Friday night that the city already was seeing a sudden surge in federal agents, describing armored vehicles and agents arriving on the streets.
President Donald Trump ordered a crackdown on alleged “organized political violence,” claiming “riots” targeted ICE agents.
Trump said the decision was necessary to protect U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement facilities.
titles: Trump says he'll send troops to Portland, Ore., to handle 'domestic terrorists'
Trump sends troops to Portland over 'domestic terrorists'
Trump directs troops to Portland with "full force" directive - Axios
Donald Trump says he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon
Trump orders U.S. troops to Portland, Oregon, authorizes ‘full force’
Trump Orders Troops To Portland—Authorizes ‘Full Force’
Trump says he’ll send troops to Portland, Oregon, in latest deployment to US cities
summary: President Trump announced on Saturday that he plans to deploy troops to Portland, Oregon, authorizing the use of "Full Force" if needed to counteract what he termed "domestic terrorists." This decision aims to protect U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement facilities. The announcement was made via social media, with no immediate details provided by the White House.

title: England Wins Third Women's Rugby World Cup, Defeating Canada 33-13
snippets: England produce a performance full of power and ferocity to defeat Canada at Twickenham and win the Women's Rugby World Cup for a third time.
England have won their third Rugby World Cup title with a commanding 13-33 performance over Canada in front of an 81,885 person home crowd in Twickenham.

• Final: Canada 13-33 England

  • Ellie Kildunne shines for largest crowd in women’s rugby history

If this were a movie, the scriptwriters would be shoo-ins for an Oscar, the plot centred on a dominant team who overcame the heartbreak of losing two back-to-back Ru
England finally has a Women's Rugby World Cup title to confirm its world domination after outclassing Canada 33-13 in front of a record crowd at Twickenham on Saturday.
England finally has a Women’s Rugby World Cup title to confirm its world domination after outclassing Canada 33-13 in front of a record crowd at Twickenham on Saturday.

England finally has a Women’s Rugby World Cup title to confirm its world domination after outclassing Canada 33-13 in front of a record crowd at Twickenham on Saturday. Victory by five tries to three capped an astonishing World Cup cycle in which England won every match, 33 in a row,
titles: England overpower Canada to win Women's World Cup
Dominant England beat Canada to win Rugby World Cup
England outclass Canada to capture glorious Women’s Rugby World Cup triumph
Canada loses in Women’s Rugby World Cup final
Canada drops Women’s Rugby World Cup final against England
Canada loses Women’s Rugby World Cup final 33-13 to England
summary: England won their third Women's Rugby World Cup title by defeating Canada 33-13 at Twickenham, in front of a record crowd of 81,885. Ellie Kildunne stood out in a game that marked England's dominance in women's rugby, completing a perfect World Cup cycle with 33 consecutive wins. This victory cements England's status as a powerhouse in the sport.

title: Yankees' Chisholm Jr. Exits Game After Being Hit by Pitch
snippets: The Yankees' Jazz Chisholm Jr. left the game against the Orioles in the fifth Saturday after being hit on the left forearm by a pitch from the Orioles' Grant Wolfram.
The second baseman was pulled after getting plunked in the fifth.
New York Yankees second baseman Jazz Chisholm Jr. takes a pitch on the arm from Baltimore Orioles pitcher Grant Wolfram and heads straight to the dugout, being replaced in the game by Jose Caballero.
titles: Yanks' Chisholm leaves after being hit by pitch
Jazz Chisholm Jr.’s X-rays negative after getting hit by pitch
Yankees’ Chisholm Jr. leaves game after taking pitch to arm
summary: Jazz Chisholm Jr., the Yankees' second baseman, exited the game in the fifth inning after being hit on the left forearm by a pitch from Orioles' Grant Wolfram. He was replaced by Jose Caballero.

title: Anaheim Ducks Sign Mason McTavish to $42M, Six-Year Extension
snippets: The Anaheim Ducks and restricted free-agent center Mason McTavish, the 2021 third overall pick who is entering his fifth season, agreed to a six-year extension, the club announced on Saturday, and an NHL source told ESPN the deal is worth $42 million.
Ducks Sign McTavish to Six-Year Contract
Sportsnet’s Elliotte Friedman reported on Saturday that the 22-year-old centre is closing in on a six-year contract extension worth $42 million. The deal carries a $7 million average annual value.
titles: Source: Ducks give McTavish six-year, $42M deal
Ducks Sign McTavish to Six-Year Contract - NHL.com
Ducks, Mason McTavish agree to six-year, $42M extension
summary: The Anaheim Ducks have signed restricted free-agent center Mason McTavish to a six-year extension worth $42 million, as announced by the club and reported by ESPN and Sportsnet's Elliotte Friedman. McTavish, the 2021 third overall pick entering his fifth season, will have an average annual value of $7 million under this deal.

title: Drones Spotted Over Danish Military Sites; Security Investigating
snippets: Unidentified drones seen at several places, including the biggest army base, after a slew of earlier sightings.
Danish security authorities said drones were seen over the country's biggest military base overnight.

Unidentified drones spotted at the countries’ biggest military bases, Karup in Denmark and Orland in Norway

Unidentified drones have been spotted over major military bases in Denmark and Norway, the latest in a series of sightings some officials have hinted might be linked to Russia.

BERLIN (AP) — The Danish defense ministry said Saturday that “drones have been observed at several of Danish defense facilities.” The new drone sightings overnight Friday into Saturday come after there were several drone sightings in the Nordic country earlier this week, with some
titles: Denmark reports new drone sightings overnight at military sites
Denmark: New drone sightings over military infrastructure
Denmark and Norway report new drone sightings over major military bases
Denmark reports new drone sightings at military facilities
summary: Unidentified drones were observed flying over several Danish military sites, including the country's largest base, Karup airbase, on Friday night. Danish security authorities are investigating the incidents, which they have described as part of a "hybrid attack." The current status of the investigation remains ongoing.

title: Europe Leads U.S. 8.5-3.5 at Ryder Cup Day 2; McIlroy Shines
snippets: The bleeding continued for the U.S. team at the 45th Ryder Cup, as the Americans lost three of four foursomes matches and trail the Europeans 8.5-3.5.

⛳ Ryder Cup updates from Bethpage Black

⛳ Ewan Murray’s day-one report |

President Donald Trump did not attend Day 2 at the Ryder Cup. That was about the only difference Saturday as Europe sent out its same foursomes teams, filled the scoreboard with blue points and delivered a crushing blow to the Americans.
Rory McIlroy was always going to be a leader of men this week, and Friday he proved his worth in spades to open the Ryder Cup.
titles: Europe extends Ryder Cup lead over reeling U.S.
Ryder Cup: USA 3½-8½ Europe – visitors extend lead after foursomes
Europe takes commanding Ryder Cup lead after winning another session
McIlroy, Europe grab early Ryder Cup lead as American top dogs falter
summary: At the 45th Ryder Cup, the U.S. team trails Europe 8.5-3.5 after losing three of four foursomes matches on Day 2. Despite changes from Day 1, Europe's strategy remained effective, with notable performance from Rory McIlroy. President Donald Trump did not attend the event.

title: US to Revoke Colombian President's Visa Over Incitement Claims
snippets: The US says it will revoke the visa of Colombian President Gustavo Petro, who urged US soldiers to disobey Trump.
The left-wing Colombian president is a critic of Trump and vocally opposes Israel's operation in Gaza. Petro is in New York for the UN General Assembly and had called on US soldiers to disobey Trump.

At a pro-Palestine protest, Petro urged US soldiers to ‘disobey Trump’s order’ and ‘not point their rifles at humanity’

The US state department said on Friday it would revoke the visa of Colombian leftist president Gustavo Petro for h
The State Department called President Gustavo Petro of Colombia reckless after he called for U.S. soldiers to disobey President Trump at a pro-Palestinian rally.
titles: US to revoke Colombian President’s visa after Gaza protest speech
Gustavo Petro: US to revoke visa of leftist Colombian leader
US revokes visa for Colombian president Gustavo Petro after ‘reckless’ actions in New York
U.S. Says It Will Revoke Colombian President’s Visa
summary: The US State Department announced it will revoke the visa of Colombian President Gustavo Petro after he encouraged US soldiers to disobey orders during a pro-Palestinian protest in New York. Petro, who was in the city for the UN General Assembly, criticized Trump and opposed Israel's actions in Gaza. His comments were deemed by the US as incitement to violence.

title: 36 Killed in Stampede at Vijay's Rally in Tamil Nadu, Toll May Rise
snippets: Tens of thousands had gathered at a campaign event for actor-turned-politician Vijay in India's southern state of Tamil Nadu.
At least 36 people were killed in a stampede at a campaign rally for the popular Tamil actor-turned-politician, officials said.
The stampede took place at an event for Joseph Vijay Chandrasekhar, the popular actor known professionally as Vijay. A health official said the toll was likely to rise.
titles: Dozens dead in crush at political rally in India
India: Dozens killed at rally for actor-politician Vijay
Stampede at Actor’s Political Rally Kills at Least 36 People in India
summary: At least 36 people were killed in a stampede during a campaign rally for actor-turned-politician Vijay in Tamil Nadu, India. The event drew tens of thousands of supporters. Health officials warn the death toll may increase.

title: Schneider Starts in Left Field for Blue Jays in Key Game Against Tampa Bay
snippets: Davis Schneider got the start in left field for the Blue Jays on Saturday against Tampa Bay as Toronto aimed to move closer to clinching the American League East Division title.
Davis Schneider gets the start in left field for the Blue Jays against Tampa Bay as Toronto aims to move closer to clinching the American League East Division title.
titles: Davis Schneider gets start in left field for Jays
Schneider gets start in left field against Rays as Blue Jays aim to trim magic number
summary: Davis Schneider was selected to start in left field for the Toronto Blue Jays in their game against Tampa Bay. This move is part of Toronto's strategy to advance towards clinching the American League East Division title.

title: Trump Calls for Firing of Microsoft Exec Lisa Monaco Over Biden Ties
snippets: Trump demands Microsoft oust global affairs chief over Biden-era ties &n
Fox Business anchor Maria Bartiromo brought up Monaco's position at Microsoft during her show. The appointment happened in July.

After successfully manipulating Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan and eventually failing to cancel Jimmy Kimmel, President Donald Trump has named his next target for retribution: Microsoft head of global affairs Lisa Monaco. He’s calling for her to be fired. On Truth Social, Trump claims that Monaco, who just to
titles: Trump demands Microsoft oust global affairs chief over Biden-era ties - Axios
Trump calls for the firing of Lisa Monaco, Microsoft president of global affairs
Trump’s new target: Microsoft head of global affairs Lisa Monaco
summary: Former President Donald Trump called for the firing of Microsoft's President of Global Affairs, Lisa Monaco, on Truth Social. Trump's demand comes after Monaco's appointment in July, citing her ties to the Biden era. This move follows Trump's previous attempts to influence corporate leadership, including Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan and a failed effort to cancel Jimmy Kimmel.

title: Sinclair, Nexstar End Boycott of "Jimmy Kimmel Live!", Resume Airing
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigwFBVV95cUxQcS1vVldJUUsyYmtBTXdWS1FtQllsaWhPMHB1Z0lLc18zMGlvTzVGTVRXQlpGTlBlYmpIX1YyUEpRS01RRFBqbzNSTS1Qb3h2QXVnN2JkcUI3bUxNaTZwdXdHV3V4QTdITV9NUUFoRVJ5YVotQmZQVnR1RlczQzJXdUhRVQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Jimmy Kimmel to return to Nexstar and Sinclair's

Sorry, Brendan Carr: Sinclair and Nexstar stop preempting Kimmel on ABC affiliates.
titles: Jimmy Kimmel to return to Nexstar and Sinclair's ABC affiliates Friday - Axios
Sinclair, Nexstar will bring 'Jimmy Kimmel Live' back to owned ABC stations on Friday
Sinclair gets nothing it asked for, puts Jimmy Kimmel back on anyway
summary: Sinclair Broadcast Group and Nexstar Media Group have ended their boycott of "Jimmy Kimmel Live!", agreeing to resume airing the late-night show on their ABC affiliate stations starting Friday night. This decision comes after a three-day preemption that left approximately 25% of US TV viewers unable to watch the program.

title: Sunderland Enters Champions League Places, Forest's Santo Dismissed
snippets: Sunderland continued their dream start back in the Premier League as Omar Alderete’s first-half goal elevated them into the Champions League places but for Nottingham Forest, for whom qualifying for Europe was not enough for Nuno Espírito Santo to keep his job beyond the season’s first internatio

Sunderland secure huge win at Forest to heap more misery on Ange
summary: Sunderland secured a spot in the Champions League places after Omar Alderete scored in the first half, contributing to their successful return to the Premier League. Despite Nottingham Forest's efforts to qualify for Europe, Nuno Espírito Santo was dismissed from his managerial position following the season's first international break.

At least 36 people have been killed and more than 50 injured in a stampede at a rally for a popular actor and politician in India.

The health minister in the southern India

At least 36 dead and more than 50 injured in stampede at Vijay rally in India
summary: At least 36 people were killed and over 50 injured in a stampede at a rally in Tamil Nadu, India, led by popular actor and politician Vijay. The incident occurred during an election campaign gathering, with eight children among the victims.

title: President Deploys Troops to Protect Immigration Facilities in Major US City
snippets: The president says the latest move to send troops to a major US city is "necessary" to protect immigration detention facilities.
Move to protect immigration enforcement facilities is fourth deployment in Democrat-controlled US cities
titles: Trump authorises 'full force' as Portland set to become latest city to see troops deployed
Trump authorises ‘full force’ as he orders troops to Portland to protect ‘war-ravaged’ city
summary: The President has announced the deployment of troops to a major US city, marking the fourth such action in Democrat-controlled cities. This move aims to safeguard immigration detention facilities, deemed "necessary" for their protection.

title: Prince William Shares 2024 as Toughest Year on "The Reluctant Traveler"
snippets: Prince William has told “Schitt's Creek” star Eugene Levy that 2024 was the hardest year of his life

LONDON (AP) — Prince William has told “Schitt’s Creek” star Eugene Levy that 2024 was the hardest year of his life. The royal made an appearance on Levy’s show “The Reluctant Traveler” and spoke about last year, which saw his wife Kate, the Princess of Wales, and his father King Charles
titles: Prince William says 2024 was the hardest year of his life
Prince William says 2024 was the hardest year of his life
summary: Prince William revealed to Eugene Levy on "The Reluctant Traveler" show that 2024 was the most challenging year of his life. This disclosure was made during an appearance that highlighted personal difficulties, involving his wife Kate, the Princess of Wales, and his father, King Charles.

title: US to Revoke Colombian President's Visa Over Incitement Claims
snippets: The State Department accused Petro of urging U.S. soldiers to disobey orders in remarks at a pro-Palestinian rally in New York.

WASHINGTON (AP) — Tensions between the United States and Colombia have escalated with the State Department announcing it was revoking a visa for Gustavo Petro, president of the Latin American country, after he participated in a New York protest where he called on American soldiers to disobey Preside
titles: State Department revokes visa for Colombian President Gustavo Petro
US revokes visa for Colombia’s president after he urges American soldiers to disobey Trump
summary: The US State Department announced it will revoke the visa of Colombian President Gustavo Petro after he encouraged US soldiers to disobey orders during a pro-Palestinian protest in New York. Petro, who was in the city for the UN General Assembly, criticized Trump and opposed Israel's actions in Gaza. His comments were deemed by the US as incitement to violence.

title: Two Women Die Crossing Channel to Britain in Makeshift Boat
snippets: Authorities say the pair died off the coast of northern France after about 100 people set off by makeshift boat.

French authorities say about 100 people were attempting to reach the UK on a makeshift boat

Two women have died while trying to cross the Channel to Britain, French authorities said.

The incident occurred south of the beaches of Neufchâtel-Hardelot, where about 100 people were trying
titles: Two women die during failed Channel crossing attempt
Two women die trying to cross Channel from France
summary: Two women died attempting to cross the Channel to Britain in a makeshift boat, according to French authorities. The incident involved around 100 people and occurred south of Neufchâtel-Hardelot, off the coast of northern France.

title: Iran Recalls Ambassadors from E3 Over Nuclear Sanctions Move
snippets: The E3 countries triggered the mechanism one month ago to reimpose sanctions, which come into effect on Sunday.

As Iran braces for potential sanctions, it has recalled its ambassadors to Germany, France and the UK. Meanwhile, Lebanon's Hezbollah group marks the first anniversary of the killing of its leader Nasrallah. Follow DW.
titles: Iran recalls envoys to UK, France, Germany as UN sanctions reimposed
Iran summons European envoys ahead of expected sanctions
summary: Iran has recalled its ambassadors from France, Germany, and the UK in response to the E3 countries triggering a mechanism to reimpose U.N. nuclear sanctions, set to take effect on Sunday. This move comes as Iran prepares for the potential impact of these sanctions.

title: U.S. Faces Government Shutdown Over Border Wall Funding Dispute
snippets: The government previously shut down during President Donald Trump's first term over disputes about funding his planned U.S.-Mexico border wall.
US government shutdowns have become so common in recent decades that every federal agency has a playbook for how to implement them.
titles: Here's what to know about a federal government shutdown
Here’s What Happens When the US Government Shuts Down
summary: During President Donald Trump's first term, the U.S. government experienced a shutdown due to disagreements over funding for a proposed U.S.-Mexico border wall. Government shutdowns have occurred frequently enough in recent years that all federal agencies now have specific guidelines for operating during such shutdowns.

title: US Lawmakers Release More Jeffrey Epstein Documents
snippets: More documents related to the late convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein have been released by lawmakers in the US.
